sentence.text: Recent GWAS completed for three types of common adult-onset glaucoma have identified novel loci for POAG (primary-open-angle glaucoma) (ABCA1, AFAP1, GMDS, PMM2, epithelial to mesenchymal transition, FNDC3B, G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway, cell cycle arrest, FOXC1, ATXN2, cell redox homeostasis); PACG (primary angle-closure glaucoma (EPDR1, phosphatidylcholine biosynthetic process, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, FERMT2, DPM2-FAM102); and exfoliation syndrome (XFS) glaucoma (CACNA1A).

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Recent studies have suggested possible therapeutic targets for some patients with early-onset glaucoma based on the molecular and cellular events caused by MYOC, positive regulation of autophagy and TBK1 mutations.
